result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Lawrence Koscinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Lawrence Koscinski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Lawrence Koscinski was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution is set at $550.00 payable to Ryan B.

Defendant to provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during the period of probation.  
Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges to the probation agent. Any missing payments and/or any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of an entry of a civil judgment.

No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with victim or the address of the offense.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Lawrence Koscinski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR RESTITUTION RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

As to Count 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to Case No. 2014CM4504, with credit for 5 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
     *   Defendant to provide DNA sample and pay
          DNA surcharge during the period of probation.          
     *   No contact with victim or the address of the offense.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges to the probation agent. 
          Any missing payments and/or any remaining balance at  
          the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of
          an entry of a civil judgment.
     *   Restitution is set at $550.00 payable to Ryan B.

 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit,received and filed

Defendant Michael Lawrence Koscinski in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

As to Count 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

As to Count 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  

Defendant missed telephone call. No action taken by the court at this time.

Defendant Michael Lawrence Koscinski in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.
Due to defendant health issues, defense requests adjourned plea/sentencing hearing.  State does not object but requests that this be last adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  All parties are notified that effective 12-01-15 this case will be assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Program violation report: Missed Telephone Contact; received and filed. Court and state reviewed violation, state takes no action at this time.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Michael Lawrence Koscinski in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Program report dated November 3, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Ryan B. or his residence or place of employment.

Defendant Michael Lawrence Koscinski in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Michael Lawrence Koscinski in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. LM   
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Michael Jude in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Michael Lawrence Koscinski not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference. Defendant is in federal prison and will be released on October 9, 2015.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Michael Lawrence Koscinski not in court, in custody at Chicago RRM and not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. For reasons stated on the record,   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Lawrence Koscinski in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Status  conference held. Court ordered August 5, 2015 at 9:00 jury trial vacated on case #14CM4504.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for 07-27-2015 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 1820 West Wells Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Ryan B. or his residence or place of employment

Defendant Michael Lawrence Koscinski in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.37  for a Status Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/17/15 @ 1:30 pm
